subject: Re: [junit] How do you turn on annotation tags?
msgSnippet: The most common problem that results in the symptoms you describe is that you extend TestCase, if you extend TestCase jUnit runs your tests with the JUnit3

The most common problem that results in the symptoms you describe is
that y=
ou extend TestCase, if you extend TestCase jUnit runs your tests
with the J=
Unit3 runner and JUnit3 does not care about annotations.
Hence, if you want=
 to use the new 4.x annotations remove "extends
TestCase" from you test and=
 you should be good to go

HTH
/J

On Sat, Sep 27, 2008 at 2:43 AM, meldrum=
 <beedude@...> wrote:
> I am using Junit4.0 inside eclipse. I tried a=
dding annotation tags
> like; @BeforeClass @AfterClass, @Ignore, etc. They =
seem to have no
> effect. Is there some extra step I need to take in order =
have the
> tags take effect?
>
> - Dave
